channel.title: Are you stereotypical?
channel.description:
Lets face it we all are stereotypical in some way and most of us might not realise it. We rarely find someone who isn't.
Be honest please. We all know if you were to guess someone's name and he was chinese or something you would be like ching chong chan or sumthing. I wanna see how much of moparisthebest is stereotypical.
Also if there any stereotypes than you often think let us know.

item.title: Are you stereotypical?
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

i do think like 95% of mexicans are dirty…

and thats not a joke.

Read full topic

@xxlegitxx wrote:

the fu superior:

it says i’m 17? i didnt bother checking my spelling

item.title: Are you stereotypical?
item.dc:creator: @whothe0 the fu superior
item.description:
@whothe0 wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:18, topic:121855”][quote author=the fu superior link=topic=171451.msg1587653#msg1587653 date=1184197412]
Just to say a few of mine.

Don’t piss off a chinese guy cuz he knows karate.
All japenise boys like YU-GI-OH!
Indian people only eat curry.
Chinese people are bad drivers.
[/quote]

Your 17 and can’t spell Japanese?

On a side note, I rarely stereotype someone.[/quote]

it says i’m 17? i didnt bother checking my spelling

Read full topic

item.title: Are you stereotypical?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“PaulT, post:10, topic:121855”]Whoah, people are wicked confused in this thread.

If you stereotype people, then you assume something about them because of your prejudicial beliefs.
If you are stereotypical, you represent a common stereotype.

For example, If I stereotyped people I might see a black person and worry he might steal my television and beat me up. If I was stereotypical, then I might dress a certain way because I skateboard.

So to answer the question posed, I don’t think I fit into any stereotypes.[/quote]

Thanks, Paul.

xxlegitxx:

Wtf. The question is so broken. A person who is stereotypical follows the stereotype, i.e. a Chinese guy wearing thick glasses playing WoW. In contrast, you are asking whether a person stereotypes. There’s a difference between a subject and an object.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @whothe0 the fu superior

Just to say a few of mine.

item.title: Are you stereotypical?
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

Ron:

I suppose everyone is to some extent, including me. Everyone generalizes/stereotypes people like all Americans are fat, all Chinese/Indians are good at math, etc. It might be the majority are fat in America or the majority are good at math in China/Indians, but in any case, it’s not always true. Not everyone from a certain country or religion or school or whatever are fat or very good at math.

I’m the math one lol

Read full topic

item.title: Are you stereotypical?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

I suppose everyone is to some extent, including me. Everyone generalizes/stereotypes people like all Americans are fat, all Chinese/Indians are good at math, etc. It might be the majority are fat in America or the majority are good at math in China/Indians, but in any case, it’s not always true. Not everyone from a certain country or religion or school or whatever are fat or very good at math.

item.title: Are you stereotypical?
item.dc:creator: @hungry_tree hungry_tree
item.description:
@hungry_tree wrote:

[quote=“3.65 kilos, post:9, topic:121855”]If you mean if I stereotype, then, well yeah.
Where I live all black people follow a black stereotype.
All white youth people follow a black stereotype.
And all Mexicans follow…well, they do what they want.[/quote]

lol

Read full topic

item.title: Are you stereotypical?
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Whoah, people are wicked confused in this thread.

If you stereotype people, then you assume something about them because of your prejudicial beliefs.
If you are stereotypical, you represent a common stereotype.

For example, If I stereotyped people I might see a black person and worry he might steal my television and beat me up. If I was stereotypical, then I might dress a certain way because I skateboard.

So to answer the question posed, I don’t think I fit into any stereotypes.

Read full topic

item.title: Are you stereotypical?
item.dc:creator: @3.65_kilos 3.65 kilos
item.description:
@3.65_kilos wrote:

If you mean if we follow a stereotype, then:

<-Geek for life

Okay, only in some ways.

If you mean if I stereotype, then, well yeah.
Where I live all black people follow a black stereotype.
All white youth people follow a black stereotype.
And all Mexicans follow…well, they do what they want.

Read full topic

i reckon it’s only possible not to be stereotypical if you never watch tv, never leave your house and never talk to any one.

if u reckon ur not stereotypical ur lying

item.title: Are you stereotypical?
item.dc:creator: @MastrChief MastrChief
item.description:
@MastrChief wrote:

I sometimes wonder when I see a black man running, where he ditched the TV…

I see Mexicans and ask if they need work.

I hate white people because they are rich.

I heard all Asians have tiny penises.

If you’re Chinese, you know some type of martial arts.

Me? Stereotypical? Nah…

For any flamers, this was a joke.

Of course I’m a little stereotypical.

Read full topic
